intro: Malapoenna obtusata, commonly known as the Malapoenna bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, arid conditions. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
